title: Portfolio Remastered
short: Interactive developer portfolio with cosmic theme and custom animations
description: A modern, interactive developer portfolio built with Next.js 13+ and TypeScript. Features a custom-built constellation engine, particle systems, 3D skill visualizations, and a comprehensive admin CMS for content management.
problem: Standard portfolios often lack interactivity and fail to demonstrate technical creativity beyond basic layout skills.
solution: Built an immersive 'cosmic' experience with mathematically generated starfields, interactive constellations, and a custom CMS, showcasing both frontend artistry and backend structure.

title: POTS: Pharmacy Order Tracking System
short: Real-time pharmacy order tracking and management platform
description: A digital platform that enables pharmacies to place, view, and track compounding orders in real time. Features secure authentication, multi-stage order tracking, role-based access, and content safety.
problem: Pharmacies had no automated order-tracking â€” staff had to call compounding centers to check order status, causing delays, lost orders, and heavy manual overhead.
solution: Built a real-time Pharmacy Order Tracking System with a centralized dashboard, role-based access, and automated workflows to reduce manual processing and improve visibility.

title: EyeMo: AI Voice-Controlled Accessibility
short: Tap-activated voice commands, OCR and scene analysis for visual accessibility
description: EyeMo empowers people with visual impairments through tap-activated voice commands, instant OCR with speech output, AI-powered scene analysis, and voice-announced location services using Azure and OpenAI.
problem: People with visual impairments lacked fast, on-device tools for quick scene understanding and OCR-assisted reading.
solution: Developed EyeMo: a tap-activated, voice-controlled app with OCR, AI scene analysis, and location announcements, powered by Azure and OpenAI, to improve situational awareness.

title: Sort Visual: Sorting Algorithm Visualizer
description: An interactive web application that visualizes various sorting algorithms, allowing users to understand their mechanics and performance through dynamic animations and user-controlled parameters.
problem: Students often struggle to grasp the concepts and mechanics of sorting algorithms through static visualizations.
solution: Created an interactive platform that allows users to visualize and manipulate sorting algorithms in real-time, enhancing understanding and engagement.

title: Coffee Mates: Capstone Project Overview Website
short: Showcase website for Coffee Mates group projects
description: A comprehensive overview website for the group Coffee Mates Projects, featuring project details, team information, and a showcase of individual contributions.
problem: The Coffee Mates project lacked a centralized platform to showcase its objectives, team members, and individual contributions.
solution: Developed a dedicated overview website using Next.js and Tailwind CSS to present the project in a cohesive manner, highlighting key features and team efforts.

title: Studdy: Task Manager
short: Task Management App that uses Local Storage for Offline Access
description: Studdy is a task management app that helps users organize their tasks using local storage for offline access.
problem: Users need a reliable way to manage tasks without an internet connection.
solution: Implemented local storage to allow users to create, read, update, and delete tasks offline, syncing changes when the connection is restored.

title: Equipment Village: Rental Management System
short: Rental management system to manage equipment, customers, rentals, and reports
description: A .NET MAUI Blazor hybrid application that centralizes inventory, customer data, rental transactions, and reporting for equipment rental businesses. Includes Razor components for Equipment, Customers, Rentals, and Reports and uses a local SQL Server (.mdf) database for persistence.
problem: Small equipment rental businesses struggled to track inventory, customers, and rental transactions using manual methods or scattered spreadsheets.
solution: Implemented an integrated rental management system with modules for managing equipment, customers, rentals, and reports, enabling staff to maintain accurate records and generate up-to-date business reports.

title: Delilah: Doggy Daycare
short: Static site with booking and contact pages for a doggy daycare
description: A lightweight static website providing online booking and contact functionality for a doggy daycare. Implements booking and contact pages with vanilla JavaScript and shared CSS styles.
problem: Small daycares needed a simple online presence to accept bookings and provide contact information without heavy backend infrastructure.
solution: Delivered a minimal, easy-to-host static site with booking and contact pages, reusable CSS, and client-side scripts for form handling.

title: Library Management System
short: Console-based library catalog with CSV persistence
description: A Python CLI application that manages a library catalog using a Book class and CSV file storage. Supports loading/saving catalogs, searching, borrowing/returning books, admin actions (add/remove/print), and simple passcode-protected librarian menu.
problem: Small libraries or practice projects needed a lightweight, file-backed catalog without a web backend.
solution: Delivered a minimal, easy-to-run command-line app that persists books to CSV, provides search and borrowing workflows, and includes an admin menu for catalog management.

title: Purchase Order Web Application
short: Modern reactive web app built with Svelte framework
description: A lightweight, reactive web application showcasing Svelte's efficient rendering and state management capabilities.
problem: Need for a performant, reactive web application with minimal bundle size.
solution: Leveraged Svelte's compile-time approach to deliver a fast, reactive user experience with optimized bundle sizes.
